model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
You job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes" or "No"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: Okay I made a playlist for our meetup this weekend. It's all punk music, but I have an hour of fun music for the pool and more steady music for our programming studies. It's going to be fun!

MEMORY:
User Description:
Speaker A is a computer programmer who enjoys adventure and travel, particularly on cruises. They have a loving workplace culture and find swimming to be a relaxing activity. Speaker A also likes pizza and cube steak. They can be nervous at times but finds swimming and programming to be rewarding and relaxing activities.

Relationship Description:
Speaker B is interested in learning programming from Speaker A and is willing to join them in swimming lessons. They share a love for punk music and pizzaburgers. Speaker B appreciates the welcoming environment at Speaker A's workplace and is open to trying new experiences like going on a cruise.

Event Description:
Speaker A and Speaker B plan to meet up next weekend and enjoy punk rock music and pizza burgers. They will also have programming lessons and swim time together. Speaker A is excited about their upcoming trip to the Caribbean and is looking forward to teaching Speaker B how to swim. Speaker B may overcome their fear of water to join Speaker A on a cruise in the future.
